name: Metabug Studio
description:
METABUG STUDIO

Pseudo-lifelike game-testing simulator (and its embedded puzzle world).

As the newest hire at the brand new game-development startup known as "Metabug Studio," you are called in to be the dedicated QA Tester on a new project for the 2021 Github GameOff game jam.  After finally arriving in the map-elusive Metabug Hills, you meet your new partner in gamedev and realize he's even more eccentric than you thought.  Maybe you'll actually have to pull your weight on this one...

//---------------------------------------------
-- Minimum System Requirements: --

CPU:  AMD Ryzen 5 (or better)
GPU:  NVidia RTX 3060 (or better)
RAM:  8 GB (or more)
Free Space:  12 GB (or more)

//-------------------------------------------

Soundtrack & Music by:
-->  Starling
-->  Winged Souls

<<<  Powered by UNREAL ENGINE 4  >>>

Includes pre-made 3D assets from the following packs:
- Brushify by JoeGarth
- Season's Trees by Evgeniy Kashirskiy
-  LP Generic Props by MadHoundGames
- ArchViz Tiny House by Mark.Zu
- Office Scene by Jaime Perez
- Free Furniture Pack by Next Level 3D
- Crosshairs Pack by Daniel1291
- Scanned 3D People by Renderpeople
- Colorama by Alex Leiva
- Modular Building Set by PurePolygons
- City Street Props by The Pocket Dimension
- Vehicle Variety Pack by Switchboard Studios

//---------------------------------------------
 SPOILER:   This game is a META WORLD for the game "Arachtron" by Metabug Studio in which the player actually helps develop the game for the game jam (the same jam to which this game is a submission). As such, this title INCLUDES Arachtron in a way that makes it playable at varying stages of functionality depending on story progress. Please check out the finished game at your leisure!

Post-Jam Update:  This game did not get finished due to time limitations (and I suppose a touch of over-scoping in earlier stages). As it stands this simply represents what I was able to put together in a month with the help of some friends. Do enjoy, it was actually pretty close to finished (for a game jam game)!
